channel.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
channel.description: I got everything working untill I load the client from the website. When I start the .jar file up from desktop, it works 100%. When I put it into a website, it keeps saying connection error - (numbers). What's happening?

item.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
item.dc:creator: @jackboy89 jackboy89
item.description:
@jackboy89 wrote:

Lol yeah I did it. Thanks for your help it worked!

Read full topic

item.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
item.dc:creator: @AfterLifeLochie AfterLifeLochie
item.description:
@AfterLifeLochie wrote:

To sign a JAR file, you must first have a private key. Private keys and their associated public-key certificates are stored in password-protected databases called keystores. A keystore can hold the keys of many potential signers. Each key in the keystore can be identified by an alias which is typically the name of the signer who owns the key. The key belonging to Rita Jones might have the alias "rita", for example.

The basic form of the command for signing a JAR file is

jarsigner jar-file alias
In this command:

jar-file is the pathname of the JAR file that’s to be signed.
alias is the alias identifying the private key that’s to be used to sign the JAR file, and the key’s associated certificate.
The Jarsigner tool will prompt you for the passwords for the keystore and alias.

Read full topic

item.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
item.dc:creator: @jackboy89 jackboy89
item.description:
@jackboy89 wrote:

[quote=“AfterLifeLochie, post:6, topic:331879”]If you have installed the Java Development Kit, you can read up about the jarsigner function at http://java.sun.com/developer/Books/javaprogramming/JAR/sign/signing.html

Edit: You’ll need a private key first. You’ll need to generate one.[/quote]

I don’t understand that at all. Lol I got lost with what they are saying.

Read full topic

item.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
item.dc:creator: @AfterLifeLochie AfterLifeLochie
item.description:
@AfterLifeLochie wrote:

If you have installed the Java Development Kit, you can read up about the jarsigner function at http://java.sun.com/developer/Books/javaprogramming/JAR/sign/signing.html

Edit: You’ll need a private key first. You’ll need to generate one.

Read full topic

item.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
item.dc:creator: @jackboy89 jackboy89
item.description:
@jackboy89 wrote:

[quote=“AfterLifeLochie, post:4, topic:331879”]Okay. There is an error, but NOT the one that I had expected. There is a connection error because of this:
Java Console:

java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.io.FilePermission nullmain_file_cache.dat read)
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkRead(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.File.exists(Unknown Source)
	at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:55)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Error connecting to server.
java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.net.SocketPermission www.fileden.com:80 connect,resolve)
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkConnect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2SecurityManager.checkConnect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHeaderField(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLConnection.getHeaderFieldInt(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLConnection.getContentLength(Unknown Source)
	at client.downloadcache(client.java:3793)
	at client.method67(client.java:3890)
	at client.method6(client.java:7681)
	at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:45)
	at client.run(client.java:5138)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Edit: There’s a problem with permissions. Where do you download your cache to? Depending on security and if you have digitally signed your application, you may not be able to access system files.[/quote]

I didn’t sign it… How can I do this? I am trying JAR Maker 0.9 but it keeps freezing.

Read full topic

item.title: [Webclient] Loading Error
item.dc:creator: @AfterLifeLochie AfterLifeLochie
item.description:
@AfterLifeLochie wrote:

Okay. There is an error, but NOT the one that I had expected. There is a connection error because of this:
Java Console:

java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.io.FilePermission nullmain_file_cache.dat read)
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkRead(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.File.exists(Unknown Source)
	at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:55)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Error connecting to server.
java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.net.SocketPermission www.fileden.com:80 connect,resolve)
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkConnect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2SecurityManager.checkConnect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown Source)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHeaderField(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLConnection.getHeaderFieldInt(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLConnection.getContentLength(Unknown Source)
	at client.downloadcache(client.java:3793)
	at client.method67(client.java:3890)
	at client.method6(client.java:7681)
	at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:45)
	at client.run(client.java:5138)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Edit: There’s a problem with permissions. Where do you download your cache to? Depending on security and if you have digitally signed your application, you may not be able to access system files.

Read full topic
